posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
There are a few things I would change about the build but overall it looks decent.

The class spread and pre-epic spread are both decent, but you should reconsider the levelling order to make epic levelling slighty easier. Moving SD1 to level 21/22 would be a simple change that improves your build's performance in early epic levels.

Elf is a decent race choice but halfling would also work well for this build. Elf gives access to longbows and shortbows, has better damage, and can use IKD on huge creatures. Halfling has +1 AB, +1 AC, +1 saves, and +2 CON compared to an elf but the small size can be a problem when fighting huge enemies. It's a shame that you don't take advantage of Keen Sense, but I think vanilla True Seeing items are available on WoG so detect skills might not be needed.

Personally I dislike min-maxing ability scores so I'd recommend starting abilities of 8STR/18DEX/10CON/16WIS/14INT/8CHA for an elf. I'm not sure why you bother increasing WIS since you don't take any WIS-related feats like Improved Ki Strike or Zen Archery. Once you reach Monk20 the extra Will won't matter much, and the Listen/Spot bonus doesn't matter since you don't invest in either skill. If you want to min-max I'd recommend starting with 20DEX and ending at 30DEX for an extra +2 AB.

The only pre-epic feat choice I disagree with is Circle Kick, but I know you're a fan so I won't try to persuade you to choose something else. The other feats are decent choices but you should rearrange them to make levelling easier.
I'd recommend something along the lines of: Dodge, Weapon Finesse, WF: Unarmed, Blind Fight, IC: Unarmed, Circle Kick, Mobility.
For epic feats, you should swap G DEX and G WIS for Armor Skin and either EWF: Unarmed or another ISR. You would get +1 AC and either +1 AB or -1 AB +2 SR respectively. If you ignore WIS and focus on DEX you could get Epic Dodge at level 27 or 30 without any Great DEX feats.

The skill choice is decent, although it would be nice to have 14 INT for 21 Spellcraft and 20ish spare points. I suggest putting at least 1 point into Disable Trap, Open Lock, and Set Trap just so that you can use them. I would prefer ending UMD at 36 (35 with CHA modifier), but that would delay UMD by 2 levels and possibly isn't worth doing on WoG anyway.

Below are buffed stats for an elf with balanced starting abilities, Armor Skin, and EWF: Unarmed. Choosing a halfling or min-maxing starting abilities would change the calculations slightly. Numbers in square brackets are comparisons to your draft build.

Assuming +12 DEX, +12WIS, +5 AB gloves, and +5 AC items:
AB: 25 (BAB) + 15 (DEX) + 3 (Feats) + 5 (AB Bonus) = +48 [+3]
AC: 10 (Base) + 15 (DEX) + 9 (WIS) + 8 (Tumble) + 2 (Feats) + 6 (Monk Bonus) + 20 (AC Bonus) = 70 [0]
HP: 318 (Base) + 0 (CON) = 318 [+80]
Fortitude: 22 (Base) + 0 (CON) = 22 [+2]
Reflex: 22 (Base) + 15 (DEX) = 37 [+1]
Will: 22 (Base) + 9 (WIS) = 31 [-3]
SR: 10 (Base) + 34 (Monk) + 12 (Feats) = 56 [0]

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content: I believe Elf is chosen for the better knockdown and for the increase in punching damage, 1d20.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
1d20 is yummy! (and necessary on WoG imo).  KD is good (love doing two in one round with Circle Kick).

Also, for the Keen Senses (I boost those skills with items and yeah, Vanilla TS).

With that much SR, there really is no need for Spellcraft.
I suggest putting at least 1 point into Disable Trap, Open Lock, and Set Trap just so that you can use them
This I do.  It just is not in the build posted here - one should imo change builds to suit taste.  Still a solid observation.

On WoG, there is no need for the build to have Armored Skin.  72 AC (haste) + 1 (dusty rose iounstone) = 73, which combined with ED (which is like a +5 to AC and causes 20s to miss) is more than enough on WoG.  In an environment where such is not enough, yeah, Armor Skin could come in handy.

I am thinking about the Wis adjustments.  More Dex means AB and AC in this build.  It's a good suggestion.

The min/max in this build needs 20 Dex.  It is necessary, both for AB and AC, especially at lower levels where one plinks at the enemy (range).  Having a +5 instead of +4 does actually make a difference.  It also "speeds" ED - which is like...yeah, mega for this build.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
So, these are the skills I invest in :

Concentration
Hide
Listen
Move Silently
Open Lock
Search
Spot
Tumble
UMD

Discipline - I do not need Discipline on WoG, I use KD immune gear (and disarm does not work against fists...unless it is a vorpal blade! :D )  In an environment where there is no KD immunity, this skill is important.

Spellcraft - No spellcraft needed, spells just bounce off.

Disarm Trap is really not needed, Improved Evasion normally takes care of that, and if it does not, regen and UMD Elemental stuff does.
Note that one could go this route if needed, just adjust skill points as necessary.

Hide and Move Silently are maxed, as is Concentration (due to being Taunted).

Open Lock is not really necessary to max - just high enough to beat most "unknockable" locks - and since picklocks +10 and other aids to pick locks abound, it is not really necessary to get this very high.

Search should be high - lots of secrets on WoG.  If there are not in your environment, one can go sparse here.

Spot is not all that high or necessary - vanilla True Seeing is really good!  Same goes for Listen.

Tumble should be 40.

UMD higher than 34 is entirely unnecessary - just boost Cha a bit and one automatically raises UMD.

As for the Skill points - if in an environment where there is no KD immunity, I would put points in there from elsewhere all the way up (obviously).  Some areas to take points from are Concentration (if in an environment where there is no Taunt).  Otherwise, take points all from Listen, Spot, Search, etc.

One may wish to increase some Disable Traps from somewhere else.  I personally don't see it that necessary, with all the Monk goodness mostly dodging/absorbing most damage here (and once UMD is taken, there are a number of elementary protection spells one can cast here).

So there it is, in all it's...numbers!  Comments and Critique are welcome, as always!
